bach_open_taxonomy.ObjectivFrame¶

class bach_open_taxonomy.ObjectivFrame(**kwargs)[source]¶

The Objectiv Frame is an extension to Bach DataFrame to use specifically for data that was collected with Objectiv’s Tracker.

It loads the data as stored by the Objectiv Tracker, makes a few transformations, and sets the right data types.

This object points to the data on which the models from the open model hub can be applied. An ObjectivFrame is instantiated with from_objectiv_data().

Methods

add_conversion_event([location_stack, ...])

Label events that are used as conversions.

apply_feature_frame_sample_changes(feature_frame)

Returns a new ObjectivFrame in which all changes made in feature_frame are applied to the full data set.

create_sample_feature_frame(table_name[, ...])

Create a df that contains only all unique combinations of the location stack and event_type.

display_sankey([stack_column, ...])

Display the Sankey chart of a location stack.

from_objectiv_data([db_url, start_date, ...])

Loads data from table into an ObjectivFrame object.

materialize(**kwargs)

Overrides materialize from Objectiv Bach.

stack_flows_from_feature_df([stack_column, ...])

Function that calculates the links between contexts on the stack.

Attributes

conversion_events

Dictionary of all events that are labeled as conversion.

end_date

End date as set with from_objectiv_data()

mh

Access the ModelHub from the ObjectivFrame.

model_hub

Access the ModelHub from the ObjectivFrame.

start_date

Start date as set with from_objectiv_data()

time_aggregation

Time aggregation used for aggregation models as set with from_objectiv_data()
